publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-218# Phil Gallie: Scottish Prison Service—That the Parliament condemns the reduction of funding for the Scottish Prison Service; expresses concern at statements made that this will lead to a reduction in prison officers, and calls upon the Scottish Executive to reverse its inappropriate and potentially dangerous decision.
S1M-218# Scottish Prison Service (lodged on 25 October 1999) Alex Fergusson*, David Mundell*

S1M-218# Phil Gallie: Scottish Prison Service—That the Parliament condemns the reduction of funding for the Scottish Prison Service; expresses concern at statements made that this will lead to a reduction in prison officers, and calls upon the Scottish Executive to reverse its inappropriate and potentially dangerous decision. Supported by: Alex Fergusson, David Mundell

S1M-218# Phil Gallie: Scottish Prison Service—That the Parliament condemns the reduction of funding for the Scottish Prison Service; expresses concern at statements made that this will lead to a reduction in prison officers, and calls upon the Scottish Executive to reverse its inappropriate and potentially dangerous decision. Supported by: Alex Fergusson, David Mundell
S1M-218# Scottish Prison Service (lodged on 25 October 1999) Mrs Lyndsay McIntosh*
S1M-218# Scottish Prison Service (lodged on 25 October 1999) Mr David Davidson*

S1M-218# Phil Gallie: Scottish Prison Service-That the Parliament condemns the reduction of funding for the Scottish Prison Service; expresses concern at statements made that this will lead to a reduction in prison officers, and calls upon the Scottish Executive to reverse its inappropriate and potentially dangerous decision. Supported by: Alex Fergusson, David Mundell, Mrs Lyndsay McIntosh, Mr David Davidson
S1M-218# Scottish Prison Service (lodged on 25 October 1999) Mr Nick Johnston*

S1M-218# Phil Gallie: Scottish Prison Service—That the Parliament condemns the reduction of funding for the Scottish Prison Service; expresses concern at statements made that this will lead to a reduction in prison officers, and calls upon the Scottish Executive to reverse its inappropriate and potentially dangerous decision. Supported by: Alex Fergusson, David Mundell, Mrs Lyndsay McIntosh, Mr David Davidson, Mr Nick Johnston
S1M-218# Scottish Prison Service (lodged on 25 October 1999) Mr Kenny MacAskill*
S1M-218# Scottish Prison Service (lodged on 25 October 1999) David McLetchie*

S1M-218# Phil Gallie: Scottish Prison Service—That the Parliament condemns the reduction of funding for the Scottish Prison Service; expresses concern at statements made that this will lead to a reduction in prison officers, and calls upon the Scottish Executive to reverse its inappropriate and potentially dangerous decision. Supported by: Alex Fergusson, David Mundell, Mrs Lyndsay McIntosh, Mr David Davidson, Mr Nick Johnston, Tricia Marwick, Mr Kenny MacAskill, David McLetchie
S1M-218# Scottish Prison Service (lodged on 25 October 1999) Mr Lloyd Quinan*
